verses.roman:
tāṅra eka svarūpa--śrī-mahā-saṅkarṣaṇa
tāṅra aṁśa 'puruṣa' haya kalāte gaṇana

synonyms: tāṅra—His; eka—one; svarūpa—manifestation; śrī-mahā-saṅkarṣaṇa—the great Lord Mahā-saṅkarṣaṇa; tāṅra—His; aṁśa—part; puruṣa—the Mahā-Viṣṇu incarnation; haya—is; kalāte gaṇana—counted as a kalā.
translation: Balarāma's own expansion is called Mahā-Saṅkarṣaṇa, and His fragment, the puruṣa, is counted as a kalā, or a part of a plenary portion.
